author: Albert Dietrich,
quote_text: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.

author: Philip Pullman
quote_text: We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence.

author: Albert Camus,
quote_text: Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.

author: Leigh Bardugo,
quote_text: When people say impossible, they usually mean improbable.

author: Plato
quote_text: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote_text: There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'

author: John W. Campbell Jr.
quote_text: History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.

author: Richelle Mead,
quote_text: Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.

author: Pablo Neruda,
quote_text: I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.

author: Haruki Murakami,
quote_text: Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote_text: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.

author: Oscar Wilde,
quote_text: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.

author: Katherine Mansfield
quote_text: The mind I love must have wild places.

author: Joseph Conrad,
quote_text: It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote_text: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.

author: Gilles Deleuze,
quote_text: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.

author: C.G. Jung
quote_text: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.

author: William Shakespeare,
quote_text: Lord, what fools these mortals be!

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote_text: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.

author: David Nicholls,
quote_text: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.

author: Maya Angelou
quote_text: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!

author: Mae West
quote_text: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.

author: Julie Kagawa,
quote_text: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
quote_text: And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes.

author: Albert Camus
quote_text: Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.

author: Roberto Bolaño,
quote_text: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.

author: William Shakespeare
quote_text: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.

author: Marvin Bell
quote_text: Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote_text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote_text: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?

author: Mark A. Cooper,
quote_text: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!

author: J.K. Rowling,
quote_text: Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
quote_text: You're something between a dream and a miracle.

author: Mark Twain
quote_text: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,
quote_text: We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken.

author: Paulo Coelho,
quote_text: Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.

author: Edward Abbey
quote_text: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
quote_text: Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them

author: George Washington
quote_text: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.

author: Thomas Pynchon
quote_text: Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.

author: Maya Angelou
quote_text: If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?

author: Anais Nin
quote_text: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote_text: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.

author: Pablo Picasso,
quote_text: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.

author: J.K. Rowling,
quote_text: Don't let the muggles get you down.

author: Zora Neale Hurston
quote_text: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.

author: J.K. Rowling,
quote_text: I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.

author: John Green,
quote_text: I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.

author: Jonathan Kellerman
quote_text: Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.

author: Douglas Coupland,
quote_text: And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.

author: Ellen DeGeneres
quote_text: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
quote_text: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced

author: Carlos Castaneda
quote_text: You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.

author: John Green,
quote_text: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.

author: Rose Wilder Lane
quote_text: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.

author: Adolf Hitler
quote_text: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!

author: Confucius,
quote_text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.

author: Kiera Cass,
quote_text: I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.

author: H.L. Mencken
quote_text: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.

author: Dean Koontz,
quote_text: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.

author: Jonathan Safran Foer
quote_text: I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.

author: e.e. cummings
quote_text: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.

author: Jack Kerouac,
quote_text: What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.

author: Doris Lessing,
quote_text: Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself — educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.

author: Kurt Vonnegut,
quote_text: Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;

author: Robert Frost
quote_text: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.

author: Napoleon Hill,
quote_text: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote_text: I restore myself when I'm alone.

author: Patrick Rothfuss,
quote_text: When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote_text: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.

author: Jojo Moyes,
quote_text: Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE.

author: Gertrude Stein
quote_text: We are always the same age inside.

author: Emily Brontë,
quote_text: If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.

author: Tolstoy Leo
quote_text: If you want to be happy, be.

author: Steve Jobs
quote_text: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.

author: John Green,
quote_text: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.

author: J.D. Salinger,
quote_text: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.

author: Woody Allen
quote_text: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.

author: Ken Kesey,
quote_text: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.

author: Selma Lagerlöf
quote_text: Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.

author: Sherman Alexie,
quote_text: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.

author: Lemony Snicket,
quote_text: The sad truth is the truth is sad.

author: Sarah J. Maas,
quote_text: Fire-breathing bitch-queen.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche,
quote_text: I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.

author: Colleen Hoover,
quote_text: Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.

author: Sarah Dessen,
quote_text: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.

author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,
quote_text: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.

author: Rachel Caine,
quote_text: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane

author: Hayley Williams
quote_text: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand

author: Albert Camus,
quote_text: I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.

author: Charles Dickens
quote_text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

author: Veronica Roth,
quote_text: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"

author: Leo Tolstoy,
quote_text: Spring is the time of plans and projects.

author: Confucius
quote_text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.

author: Joseph Conrad,
quote_text: We live as we dream--alone....

author: Mary Ann Shaffer,
quote_text: I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.

author: Stephen Chbosky,
quote_text: I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote_text: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.

author: Jennifer Niven,
quote_text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.

author: Walter Tevis
quote_text: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.

author: George R.R. Martin,
quote_text: What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.

author: Charles Bukowski
quote_text: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.

author: Oscar Wilde,
quote_text: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.

author: Erin Morgenstern,
quote_text: You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.

author: Barbara Kingsolver,
quote_text: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.

author: Robert Heinlein,
quote_text: Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.

author: Paulo Coelho,
quote_text: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.

author: Sarah Kay
quote_text: If I should have a daughter…Instead of Mom, she’s gonna call me Point B. Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.

author: William Shakespeare
quote_text: My only love sprung from my only hate!

author: Charlotte Brontë,
quote_text: I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.

author: J.K. Rowling,
quote_text: You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote_text: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.

author: Gertrude Stein
quote_text: One must dare to be happy.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote_text: I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.

author: Jane Austen,
quote_text: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.

author: Brian Selznick,
quote_text: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.

author: George Carlin
quote_text: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote_text: I just want to be wonderful.

author: Lewis Caroll,
quote_text: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.

author: Ben Okri
quote_text: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity

author: C. JoyBell C.
quote_text: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.

author: Paulo Coelho,
quote_text: People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.

author: Jarod Kintz,
quote_text: I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.

author: Virginia Woolf,
quote_text: As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.

author: Tahereh Mafi,
quote_text: Ignite, my love. Ignite.

author: Erica Jong
quote_text: I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....

author: Lewis Carroll
quote_text: One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.

author: Steven Moffat
quote_text: Demons run when a good man goes to war

author: Suzanne Collins,
quote_text: I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."

author: Christopher Moore,
quote_text: People, generally, suck.

author: E.E. Cummings,
quote_text: I will take the sun in my mouth

author: Cassandra Clare,
quote_text: I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-"

author: Tim O'Brien
quote_text: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.

author: Samuel Beckett
quote_text: We are all born mad. Some remain so.

author: أحلام مستغانمي,
quote_text: الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا

author: L.M. Montgomery,
quote_text: True friends are always together in spirit.

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote_text: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.

author: Suzanne Collins,
quote_text: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.

author: Nora Roberts
quote_text: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.

author: Tamora Pierce,
quote_text: Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.

author: James Lecesne
quote_text: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.

author: Neil Gaiman,
quote_text: Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway,

author: Suzanne Collins,
quote_text: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!

author: Paulo Coelho
quote_text: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,
quote_text: It takes something more than intelligence to act intelligently.

author: Becca Fitzpatrick,
quote_text: Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote_text: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.

author: Leigh Bardugo,
quote_text: The Darkling slumped back in his chair. Fine, he said with a weary shrug. Make me your villain.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
quote_text: You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote_text: sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love

author: Audrey Niffenegger,
quote_text: Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.

author: Robert Frost
quote_text: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.

author: Chaim Potok,
quote_text: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.

author: C. J. Cherryh
quote_text: Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!

author: Mother Teresa
quote_text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.

author: Gena Showalter,
quote_text: I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist

author: A.A. Milne,
quote_text: If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.

author: Lois Lowry
quote_text: It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.

author: George Carlin
quote_text: I like it when a flower or a little tuft of grass grows through a crack in the concrete. It's so fuckin' heroic.

author: جلال الدين الرومي
quote_text: لا تجزع من جرحك، وإلا فكيف للنور أن يتسلل إلى باطنك؟

author: Alysha Speer
quote_text: Laugh, even when you feel too sick or too worn out or tired.

author: A.A. Milne,
quote_text: I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.

author: Henry David Thoreau,
quote_text: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..

author: Nicholas Sparks,
quote_text: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life

author: Bill Watterson,
quote_text: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.

author: Cassandra Clare,
quote_text: Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
quote_text: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.

author: John Banville,
quote_text: The past beats inside me like a second heart.

author: Milan Kundera
quote_text: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace.

author: Robin  Williams
quote_text: See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.

author: Haruki Murakami,
quote_text: Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote_text: Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.

author: OMAR KHAYYAM,
quote_text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

author: Frank Kaiser
quote_text: Yes, we praise women over 40 for a multitude of reasons. Unfortunately, it's not reciprocal. For every stunning, smart, well-coiffed, hot woman over 40, there is a bald, paunchy relic in yellow pants making a fool of himself with some 22-year old waitress. Ladies, I apologize. For all those men who say, "Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?", here's an update for you. Nowadays 80% of women are against marriage. Why? Because women realize it's not worth buying an entire pig just to get a little sausage!

author: John Green,
quote_text: What else? She is so beautiful. You don’t get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You don’t get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.
